#summary Instructions for users on how to install acedit
This page provides instructions on how to install and use the *acedit* tool for end users.

= Installation =

==Install Eclipse==

The [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-modeling-tools/indigosr2 Eclipse Modeling Tools] distribution is recommended, in which the tool was implemented and tested. In addition this version of Eclipse contains some of the prerequisites for the *acedit*.

----

==Install the necessary Eclipse plugins==

The update sites you will need to install the plugins are:

 * http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/gmp/emf/updates/releases/ . Installs the Graphical Model Framework tools
 * http://download.eclipse.org/epsilon/updates/ . Installs the Epsilon framework

----

==Install the Assurance Case Argument Editor==

The install the *acedit* tool through eclipse updates using the following update site: 
 * http://acedit.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/GSN.updatesite

=Create your first project=

After you successfully have completed the installation, you must be able to create you first acedit project. Below are presented the steps you must follow in Eclipse:

 # select File->new->project
 # select General-> Project
 # select next and give a name to your project
 # select finish
 # press right click in the created project
 # select New->Other
 # in the pop up wizard type GSN
 # select GSN1 diagram
 # select Next-> Finish

You must be able to see the acedit editor in your workspace and start creating your project!
